Bueno, as=ED concluye mi di=E1logo con LaMothe:

"Andre',

I've checked wit=
h some colleagues, and the best I could get are five casino
games from a lo=
cal game development company. I could put you in contact with
them if you a=
re interested, I think these are C++ / DirectX games.

Apart from my work o=
n my own games company, I'm one in the board of
directors of the Argentina =
Game Development Association (Adva,
http://www.adva.com.ar/ ), and as such =
I have direct contact with most
development teams in this country. From tha=
t contact, I know there are a lot
of small games that keep unpublished here=
 (with small, meaning small as in
Randomedia, which weights 5 mbs so isn't =
small as in Minesweeper), and even
some larger games as a 3d strategy game =
that is failing to get a good
publishing contract. I wonder if Xtreme Games=
 would be interested on knowing
about these products, and if there could be=
 any interesting business deal
(for their owners, not me) involving those.
=

What do you think about it?"

A lo que respondi=F3:

"Sure put me in touch=
 with these people, but like I said, I am the ONLY
person in this biz that =
doesn't bullshit people - there is ABSOLUTELY no
money in this, if I like t=
heir games, I will license them and when the
time comes and the right bundl=
e comes I will get them in the bundle and
they will make a couple hundred b=
ucks, but for that couple hundreds
bucks they will have to do hours of bug =
fixes, changes, etc. to make the
games of commercial release quality in ter=
ms of robust code that can run
on 10,000 machines without a problem. So if =
they are interested in this
for the fun of it, don't mind making a couple b=
ucks then I am all for
it, but if they are under the wrong impression that =
game developers get
rich still then they shouldn't waste their time with me=
 :)

I have worked with 2500+ game developers over the past 10 years, and
o=
nly 1% of them make any real money, the rest don't, that's the nature
of th=
is biz."

Antes hab=EDa dicho que:

"All I can license are complete C++/ASM=
/DirectX games, and it might take
months to 2 years to place them in stores=
, and the same amount for
royalties to come in. Each game might make $250-5=
00 in its lifetime --
this is a biz of numbers now, no one will pay anythin=
g for a single game
unless its Doom III, so you have to give them 200-400 g=
ames in a bundle,
we make $3 a bundle, get 30 cents net, divide it by 400 t=
hen give the
developer his cut -- do the math, it sucks..

Right now if you=
 have 12 casino games in english and 30-40 other puzzle
games in english I =
might be able to make you $10K over the next 2 years
with them, that's a ph=
enomenal deal -"

y un poco despu=E9s:

"I need it this week and it would h=
ave to be done of course, and only one
game isn't worth the time for either=
 of us, the legal alone, Q/A, etc.
would cost 10x as much since we always m=
ake changes, splash screens,
bugs etc., we like to do 5-10 games min at onc=
e totally done. But, yes,
we usually do NON exclusive of course."

No s=E9 =
si les parece que se puede hacer algo que valga la pena a partir de ese pun=
to... por lo pronto, por lo que s=E9 todos los publishing deals de Xtreme G=
ames son no exclusivos, por lo que no hay mucho que perder (salvo el trabaj=
o que implica QA, bug hunting y todo eso). Por otra parte no parece interes=
ado en tomar juegos de a uno, no s=E9 si juntando de a varias empresas... P=
or lo pronto lo =FAnico que me queda claro es que quienes tengan varios jue=
gos juntos C++ / DX o quienes cumplan con el otro pedido de Casino para pre=
sentar tienen una buena chance, contacten a la gente de Xtreme (o cont=E1ct=
enme a m=ED si tienen alguna duda) y ven qu=E9 sale. En cualquier caso, bue=
na suerte :)

Saludos,

ldo.com.ar/
